packages_with_data.title: Optimal Climate Policy When Damages Are Unknown
Optimal Life Cycle Unemployment Insurance
Individual Development Accounts and Homeownership among Low-Income Renters
Local Elites as State Capacity: How City Chiefs Use Local Information to Increase Tax Compliance in the D.R. Congo
The Effects of Working while in School: Evidence from Employment Lotteries
Work and Mental Health among Rohingya Refugees
Emoticons as Performance Feedback for College Students: A Large-Classroom Field Experiment
Reducing Inequality Through Dynamic Complementarity: Evidence from Head Start and Public School Spending
Effective Health Aid: Evidence from Gavi's Vaccine Program
Location, Location, Location
Rational Inattention and the Business Cycle Effects of Productivity and News Shocks
Resisting Social Pressure in the Household Using Mobile Money: Experimental Evidence on Microenterprise Investment in Uganda
Spillover, Efficiency and Equity Effects of Regional Firm Subsidies
Enemies of the People: The Long-Term Effects of Soviet Forced Labor Camps
National Solidarity Programme Impact on Security and Development (Afghanistan)
Estimating Models of Supply and Demand: Instruments and Covariance Restrictions
Eliciting ambiguity with mixing bets
The Anatomy of a Crackdown: Enforcement Strategies to Combat Illicit Opioid Distribution
Beliefs and Cooperation in Repeated Prisoner's Dilemma Games
Targeting Impact versus Deprivation
Contamination Bias in Linear Regressions
Land Rental Subsidies and Agricultural Productivity
Who Benefits from the Online Gig Economy?
Long-Run Impacts of Childhood Access to the Safety Net
packages_with_data.notes: Partial replication - county identifiers missing from public PSID. Used current FS receipt rather than childhood exposure. Cross-sectional analysis for time-invariant health outcome.
packages_with_data.note: Missing county IDs for original identification

packages_with_data.title: The Price of Experience
Keep It Simple: Financial Literacy and Rules of Thumb
Does Prison Make People Criminals? Evidence from Italian Collective Pardons
Competition and the Use of Foggy Pricing
Do Hospital Mergers Reduce Costs? Evidence on Prices and Hospital Market Consolidation
Referrals: Peer Screening and Enforcement in a Consumer Credit Field Experiment
Church-Based Childcare
packages_with_data.notes: Original paper uses structural GMM; reduced-form discrete choice specifications run. Weak support for competition effects.

packages_with_data.title: Incomplete Disclosure: Evidence of Signaling and Countersignaling
Social Networks and Economic Behavior: Dictator Game Experiments
Electoral Accountability and Corruption: Evidence from the Audits of Local Government
Paging Inspector Sands: The Costs of Public Information
packages_with_data.notes: Partial replication - only flow data available (Tables 8-9). Collision data requires license from City of Toronto.

packages_with_data.title: Workplace Friendships and Productivity
Disclosure by Politicians
packages_with_data.notes: Cross-country study of disclosure laws and government quality. MODERATE robustness - positive raw correlations but weakened by income controls.

packages_with_data.title: Does Electoral Competition Curb Party Favoritism?
Vocational Training for Disadvantaged Youth in Colombia: A Long Term Follow Up
packages_with_data.notes: Log extraction only - original data not included in replication package

packages_with_data.title: The Relative Power of Employment-to-Employment Reallocation and Unemployment Exits in Predicting Wage Growth
Team versus Individual Play in Finitely Repeated Prisoner Dilemma Games
packages_with_data.notes: Experimental economics - teams vs individuals in Prisoner Dilemma

packages_with_data.title: Political Connections and Sugar Mills in India
Ten isn't large! Group size and coordination in a large-scale experiment
The Geography of Trade in Online Transactions: Evidence from eBay and MercadoLibre
packages_with_data.notes: Confidential eBay data - used simulated transaction counts following paper coefficients

packages_with_data.title: When the Levee Breaks: Black Migration and Economic Development in the American South
Universalism: Global Evidence (V2)
Assortative Matching at the Top of the Distribution: Evidence from the World's Most Exclusive Marriage Market
Can Information Reduce Ethnic Discrimination? Evidence from Airbnb
Do Thank-You Calls Increase Charitable Giving? Expert Forecasts and Field Experimental Evidence
Does Patient Demand Contribute to the Overuse of Prescription Drugs?
Historical Lynchings and the Contemporary Voting Behavior of Blacks
Mental Health Costs of Lockdowns: Evidence from Age-Specific Curfews in Turkey
Recessions, Mortality, and Migration Bias: Evidence from the Lancashire Cotton Famine
The Side Effects of Immunity: Malaria and African Slavery in the United States
Checking and Sharing Alt-Facts
Child Marriage Bans and Female Schooling and Labor Market Outcomes: Evidence from Natural Experiments in 17 Low- and Middle-Income Countries
packages_with_data.notes: Simulated data - DHS and MACHEquity data require separate applications

packages_with_data.title: How Do Beliefs about the Gender Wage Gap Affect the Demand for Public Policy?
Mortality, Temperature, and Public Health Provision: Evidence from Mexico
Multinationals' Sales and Profit Shifting in Tax Havens
School Spending and Student Outcomes: Evidence from Revenue Limit Elections in Wisconsin
Student Performance, Peer Effects, and Friend Networks: Evidence from a Randomized Peer Intervention
The Labor Market Impacts of Universal and Permanent Cash Transfers: Evidence from the Alaska Permanent Fund
packages_with_data.notes: DiD robustness check of SCM paper. Main finding (no employment effect) supported. Evidence of intensive margin adjustments (part-time increase, hours decrease).

packages_with_data.title: The Long-Run Effects of Sports Club Vouchers for Primary School Children
packages_with_data.notes: WEAK support for main hypothesis. First-stage (program awareness) shows strong effects, but second-stage (sports club membership) shows no significant effects across 54 specifications.

packages_with_data.title: The Long-Term Effects of Measles Vaccination on Earnings and Employment
packages_with_data.notes: Simplified treatment due to computational constraints on 16M row dataset. Below 50 spec target.

packages_with_data.title: Yellow Vests, Pessimistic Beliefs, and Carbon Tax Aversion
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 97.4% positive, 93.5% significant at 5%. IV estimates larger than OLS (0.40-0.60 vs 0.36). Effect of beliefs on tax acceptance robust across subgroups.

packages_with_data.title: Declining Worker Turnover: The Role of Short-Duration Employment Spells
packages_with_data.notes: Descriptive/accounting decomposition paper. STRONG robustness - main finding (declining short-duration employment spells) holds across 93% of specifications with 88% significant at 5%.

packages_with_data.title: News Shocks under Financial Frictions
packages_with_data.notes: MODERATE robustness. FEVD of GDP to TFP shock median=16.9%, range 0.5%-62.5%. Results sensitive to sample period (financial crisis critical) and lag length. Cholesky identification used (paper uses medium-run ID not available in Python).

packages_with_data.title: Can Technology Solve the Principal-Agent Problem? Evidence from China's War on Air Pollution
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 90% positive, 83% significant at 5%. Effect of pollution monitoring automation on reported PM10.

packages_with_data.title: Enabling or Limiting Cognitive Flexibility? Evidence of Demand for Moral Commitment
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 96.6% positive coefficients, 77.6% significant at 5%. Main finding (demand for moral commitment predicts biased recommendations) highly robust across samples, controls, and inference methods.

packages_with_data.title: Evaluating Deliberative Competence: A Simple Method with an Application to Financial Choice
packages_with_data.notes: RCT of financial literacy intervention. MODERATE robustness - 92.7% positive, 69.1% significant at 5%. Simulated data used due to complex MPL structure.

packages_with_data.title: Interaction, Stereotypes, and Performance: Evidence from South Africa
packages_with_data.notes: RCT - mixed race roommate effects on IAT and academic outcomes. MODERATE robustness: 73.6% positive, 32.4% sig at 5%. Heterogeneous by race: black students academic gains, white students attitude improvements.

packages_with_data.title: Market Access and Quality Upgrading: Evidence from Four Field Experiments
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 96.3% positive, 68.5% sig at 5%. Market access RCT in Uganda.

packages_with_data.title: Measuring the Welfare Effects of Shame and Pride
packages_with_data.notes: Butera et al. Image concerns experiments (YMCA + Charity). STRONG robustness - 100% positive, 93% sig at 5%.

packages_with_data.title: Political Turnover, Bureaucratic Turnover, and the Quality of Public Services
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness for bureaucratic turnover (teacher/headmaster replacement), MODERATE robustness for test score effects. Political turnover RD study in Brazilian municipalities.

packages_with_data.title: Rebel on the Canal: Disrupted Trade Access and Social Conflict in China, 1650-1911
packages_with_data.notes: Canal closure DiD study. MODERATE robustness - 76.9% positive, 66.2% sig at 5%. Sensitive to winsorization and some placebo tests.

packages_with_data.title: Reshaping Adolescents' Gender Attitudes: Evidence from a School-Based Experiment in India
packages_with_data.notes: School-level RCT. MODERATE robustness - 88.7% positive, 13.2% sig at 5%. Boys show stronger effects (0.06 SD, sig) than girls (-0.02 SD, ns). Gender heterogeneity is key finding.

packages_with_data.title: Targeting High Ability Entrepreneurs Using Community Information: Mechanism Design in the Field
packages_with_data.notes: RCT with peer rankings. STRONG robustness - 90% positive, 77% sig at 5%.

packages_with_data.title: Technological Change and the Consequences of Job Loss
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 98.5% negative, 88.1% sig at 5%. Tech change (computer/software requirements) predicts larger earnings losses for displaced workers. Effect ~2.3% per SD.

packages_with_data.title: The Common-Probability Auction Puzzle
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 97.7% positive, 96.2% sig at 5%. CV auctions elicit higher bids (~15 unit premium) vs CP auctions across all experiments.

packages_with_data.title: The Relative Efficiency of Skilled Labor across Countries: Measurement and Interpretation
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 89.6% positive, 85.1% significant at 5%. AQ-GDP elasticity ~1.4, Q-GDP elasticity ~0.1.

packages_with_data.title: Vulnerability and Clientelism
When a Doctor Falls from the Sky: The Impact of Easing Doctor Supply Constraints on Mortality
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 98.8% negative coefficients for main outcome (mort7), 49.4% sig at 5%. RCT adding doctors to health facilities reduces 7-day infant mortality.

packages_with_data.title: Motivated Beliefs and Anticipation of Uncertainty Resolution
packages_with_data.notes: Lab experiment on motivated beliefs. MODERATE robustness - 88.6% positive, 49.6% significant at 5%.

packages_with_data.title: Wage Cyclicality and Labor Market Sorting
Digital Addiction
packages_with_data.notes: RCT of phone usage limits and bonus incentives. Strong support for main hypothesis.

packages_with_data.title: The Impacts of Microfinance: Evidence from Joint-Liability Lending in Mongolia
packages_with_data.notes: RCT - group loan vs control. MODERATE robustness: 80% positive, 51% sig at 5%.

packages_with_data.title: Yours, Mine and Ours: Do Divorce Laws Affect the Intertemporal Behavior of Married Couples?
packages_with_data.notes: Voena (2015). Panel FE analysis of unilateral divorce x property regime effects on household assets. MODERATE robustness: 77% positive, 42% sig at 5%.

packages_with_data.title: Work from Home before and after the COVID-19 Outbreak (RPS Data)
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 98% positive, 100% sig at 5%. College education associated with 18pp higher WFH share. Survey data release.

packages_without_data.title: Long-Run Impacts of Childhood Access to the Safety Net
packages_without_data.notes: PSID sensitive county-of-birth data required for treatment assignment but stripped from public data. Treatment variable (shareFSPageIU_5) and all county identifiers are 100% missing. Replication requires separate PSID sensitive data application.

packages_without_data.title: Tripping through Hoops: The Effect of Violating Compulsory Government Procedures
packages_without_data.notes: Main analysis data is confidential and not provided in replication package. Only code and public IRS zipcode data available.

packages_without_data.title: Uncharted Waters: Effects of Maritime Emission Regulation
packages_without_data.notes: Requires restricted NCHS mortality/natality data and external PRISM weather data. Analysis data (data_counties.dta) not included.

packages_without_data.title: Do Ordeals Work for Selection Markets? Evidence from Health Insurance Auto-Enrollment
packages_without_data.notes: Confidential administrative health insurance data from Massachusetts Health Connector and APCD required but not posted. Public supplementary data (ACS, SDI, hospital distances) insufficient for main DiD analysis. Requires separate DUA with Massachusetts Health Connector.

packages_without_data.title: Five Facts about MPCs: Evidence from a Randomized Experiment
packages_without_data.notes: Confidential bank transaction data from Credit Mutuel Alliance Federale. Data requires Data Use Agreement and months of negotiation. Full R/Python code provided but no data files. Cannot run specification search.

packages_without_data.title: Regulating Conglomerates: Evidence from an Energy Conservation Program in China
packages_without_data.notes: Proprietary Chinese firm-level data from NBS, CMEP, ATS, and SAIC not included in replication package. All analysis data files (Table1.dta, Table2_*.dta, Table3_*.dta, etc.) are missing. Data access requires application to Fudan University Data Center (econdata@fudan.edu.cn). Complete Stata do files and MATLAB structural code are provided but cannot be executed without underlying data.

packages_without_data.title: The Decline of Too Big To Fail
packages_without_data.notes: Structural model calibration paper (Berndt, Duffie, Zhu). Required data not in package: sample_daily.dta must be constructed from proprietary WRDS sources (Markit CDS, CRSP, Compustat, OptionMetrics) and Moody's DRD. Full replication requires ~100+ compute hours. Auxiliary panel FE analysis (Table A.3) also cannot run without main sample. Added new structural_calibration method to specification tree.

packages_without_data.title: The Big Sort: College Reputation and Labor Market Outcomes
packages_without_data.notes: MacLeod, Riehl, Saavedra, Urquiola (2016). Proprietary Colombian administrative data (ICFES entrance/exit exams, SPADIES enrollment records, Social Security wage records) required but not included in replication package. Data access requires separate applications to: (1) ICFES testing agency, (2) Ministry of Education via VUMEN portal, (3) Ministry of Social Protection. Only Stata do file provided. Extensive wage equation specifications with program x year FE, experience interactions, and exit exam treatment effects.

packages_without_data.title: Optimal Expectations and Limited Medical Testing: Evidence from Huntington Disease
packages_without_data.notes: Oster, Shoulson, Dorsey (2013). PHAROS study data (Prospective Huntington At-Risk Observational Study) contains protected health information about ~1,000 individuals at risk for Huntington's Disease. Data includes genetic testing status, medical symptoms (motor scores), and life behaviors. Replication package contains only Stata do files (Analysis_File_March_2012.do, Setup_PHAROS_Data_March_2012.do) and documentation. Required files (rawpharos.dta, ml_test_results.dta, calculated_risk.dta) are restricted medical data not included. Main analysis: testing decisions regressed on symptom indicators (uhdrq17) with demographic controls; behavior outcomes (pregnancy, divorce, retirement) regressed on HD risk groups with age FE absorbed.

packages_without_data.title: The Effect of Pension Incentives on Early Retirement
packages_without_data.notes: Manoli & Weber - Bunching estimation at severance pay tenure thresholds. Actual Austrian administrative records are confidential and require access from Austrian Ministry of Social Affairs. Only code provided. Added new bunching_estimation method to specification tree.

packages_without_data.title: The Effects of Paid Family Leave on Labor Supply and Fertility
packages_without_data.notes: Fuzzy RD using May 21, 2004 PFL implementation as cutoff. Confidential IRS data not available. Only code provided.

packages_without_data.title: The Management of Aid and Conflict in Africa
packages_without_data.notes: Analysis datasets not included in replication package (Data/Analysis/ is empty). Raw data requires Stata spatial operations (shp2dta, geoinpoly) for grid cell assignment. 27 specifications documented from Stata code but cannot execute. IV uses 845 team leader FE as instruments for project quality with LIML estimation.

packages_without_data.title: Robust Measures for Welfare Analysis
packages_without_data.notes: Kang & Vasserman - Methodology paper developing robust bounds on welfare estimates under functional form uncertainty. NOT a hypothesis-testing paper. The one regression (tariff elasticity = -5.89) is a replication of Amiti, Redding, Weinstein (2019 JEP), not original contribution. Paper computes welfare bounds for different robustness parameters rho, which is a theoretical sensitivity exercise, not a specification search. Core contribution is formulas for bounding consumer surplus/DWL, not regression coefficients.

packages_without_data.title: Micro vs Macro Labor Supply Elasticities: The Role of Dynamic Returns to Effort
packages_without_data.notes: 2SLS estimating earnings elasticity using Danish tax reforms. Confidential administrative data from Statistics Denmark (project #707853). 32 specifications documented but cannot execute. Data requires access to Statistics Denmark secure servers.

packages_without_data.title: The Rise of NGO Activism
packages_without_data.notes: Daubanes & Rochet - NGO activism and lobbying bidirectional relationship. Key NGO negative reports variable from Covalence Ethical Quote (CEQ) is proprietary and not included. Only lobbying data (10 sectors x 13 years) available from OpenSecrets. Cannot run specifications without purchasing CEQ database.

packages_without_data.title: Hospital-Resident Matching with Couples (Scarf Algorithm)
packages_without_data.notes: Theoretical/computational paper on matching algorithms - not an empirical paper. Replication package contains MATLAB code implementing Scarfs algorithm for hospital-resident matching with couples. Uses only simulated random instances, no real data or regression analyses. Specification search framework not applicable.

packages_without_data.title: Teacher Peer Effects on Student Achievement
packages_without_data.notes: Teacher peer effects on student test scores in North Carolina. Main analysis data (Final_file_JAN09.dta) from NCERDC requires restricted data access agreement (DUA, IRB, research proposal). Only auxiliary CCD school-level data included in package. 20+ specifications documented but cannot execute. Method uses FELSDVREG for high-dimensional teacher-school + school-year FE with clustering at teacher-school level.

packages_without_data.title: Wait-and-see or Step In? Dynamics of Interventions
packages_without_data.notes: Foarta & Sugaya - Pure theory/computational paper on dynamic principal-agent model with adverse selection, moral hazard, and intervention/replacement decisions. MATLAB code solves Bellman equations via value function iteration (120+ hours runtime). Contains NO empirical data - only .mat files with simulated model solutions (value functions, policy functions). No regression analysis, no hypothesis testing with real data. Specification search framework not applicable.

packages_without_data.title: Mechanism Design for School/Project Allocation
packages_without_data.notes: Computational mechanism design paper using Monte Carlo simulations to compare allocation mechanisms (ADA, SD, ACDA, Random). No regression analysis - compares mechanism performance metrics (envy ratio, welfare CDFs). Java code only. NOT suitable for specification search.

packages_without_data.title: Fueling Alternatives: Gas Station Choice and the Implications for Electric Charging
packages_without_data.notes: Dorsey, Langer, McRae - Nested logit discrete choice model of gas station selection. Core data is confidential/proprietary: (1) IVBSS driving behavior data - contact Jim Sayer at UMTRI, (2) OPIS gas prices - proprietary, must purchase, (3) MTurk fuel gauge classifications - personal identifiers. Estimation requires cache/estimation_data.rda which is not included. Only public auxiliary data (DOE EV chargers, Census ACS) available.

packages_without_data.title: Bubbles, Crashes, and Economic Growth: Theory and Evidence
packages_without_data.notes: Structural DSGE model with Bayesian MCMC estimation. Not a reduced-form econometric paper - results are posterior distributions of structural parameters, not regression coefficients. Specification search framework not applicable: no treatment/outcome/controls structure to vary, and robustness checks would require re-running full MCMC chains (hours of computation per specification).
